description: Middle French inciter, from Latin incitare (“to set in motion, hasten, urge, incite”), from in (“in, on”) + citare (“to set in motion, urge”), frequentative of ciere (“to rouse, excite, call”).

verbs.description: incite (third-person singular simple present incites, present participle inciting, simple past and past participle incited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To stir up or excite; to rouse or goad into action.
examples: The judge was told by the accused that his friends had incited him to commit the crime.
